@ConstitutionParty @ConstitutionPartyServices @ConstitutionPartyLA @ConstitutionPartyofLouisiana @CPofLouisiana @CPofCC1776 @VoterGA History1992: A coalition of independent state parties united to form the U.S. Taxpayers Party. The party‚Äôs founder, Howard Phillips, was on the ballot in 21 states as its first presidential candidate.1995: Party recognized by Federal Election Commission as a national party bringing the number of nationally recognized parties to 5.1999: Name changed to ‚ÄúConstitution Party‚Äù by delegates at the National Convention to better reflect the party‚Äôs primary focus of returning government to the U.S. Constitution‚Äôs provisions and limitations. A BRIEF ELECTION HISTORY1992: A coalition of independent state parties united to form the U.S. Taxpayers Party at its first national convention in New Orleans, Louisiana.  Among the notable convention speakers was former Congressman Ron Paul. The party‚Äôs founder, Howard Phillips of Virginia, Chairman of the grass-roots lobby, the Conservative Caucus, was nominated to be the party‚Äôs first candidate for President with retired Army Brigadier General Albion Knight of Maryland nominated as the party‚Äôs first vice-presidential running mate. The US Taxpayer‚Äôs Party secured ballot position in 21 states.1996: Howard Phillips was again nominated to be the party‚Äôs presidential candidate for the 1996 campaign at the party‚Äôs national convention held in San Diego, California.  Attorney and writer Herb Titus of Oregon was the Constitution Party‚Äôs Vice President nominee. Ballot access was achieved in 39 states for the 1996 elections, representing over 80% of the Electoral College votes available.2000: Delegates attending the National Convention in September 1999 voted to change the name of the US Taxpayer‚Äôs Party to ‚ÄúConstitution Party‚Äù to better reflect the party‚Äôs primary focus of returning government to the U.S. Constitution‚Äôs provisions and limitations.  For a third and last time, Howard Phillips was nominated to serve as the standard bearer for the newly named Constitution Party for the 2000 election. Missouri surgeon Dr. J. Curtis Frazier was the nominee for Vice President. The convention was held in St. Louis, Missouri.2004: The Constitution Party achieved ballot access in 41 states and, at its convention in Valley Forge, Pennsylvania, it nominated Maryland lawyer Michael Peroutka, founder of the Institute on the Constitution, as its presidential nominee with Florida minister and commentator Chuck Baldwin as its nominee for Vice-President. Although the Constitution Party was on fewer state ballots in 2004, the vote tally increased by 40 percent compared to the 2000 elections while other ‚Äòalternative‚Äô parties lost ground or barely matched their 2000 vote totals.2008: At its Kansas City, Missouri national convention, the Constitution Party nominated its 2004 nominee for Vice President, Chuck Baldwin of Florida, to be its 2008 nominee for President, selecting attorney and Constitution Party activist Darrell Castle of Tennessee, to serve as the Vice-presidential nominee.2012: Former six-term Virginia Congressman, Virgil Goode, was nominated for President at the Constitution Party National Convention held in Nashville, Tennessee. Three-term Constitution Party National Chairman, attorney Jim Clymer of Pennsylvania, was nominated to serve as Goode‚Äôs running mate.2016: Founding Constitution Party member, three term Vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Constitution Party, and 2008 Constitution Party Vice-presidential Candidate Darrell Castle was nominated for President. Mr. Castle‚Äôs running mate was Dr. Scott Bradley of Utah who holds a PhD in Constitutional Law. The campaign garnered over 200,000 votes setting a Constitution Party record.

‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ
* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):
* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

"West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)

Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"

Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."

DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."
Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."

H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."

Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."
eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'"

Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

#BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ
* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):
* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

"West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)

Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"

Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."

DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."
Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."

H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."

Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."
eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'"

_source.content: Wayne Allen Root has the best response to possible Trump arrest:By Wayne Allyn RootHere is the problem in America right now‚Ä¶The Democrats are evil, radical, nasty, vile, low-down, dirty skunks. Dirty Democrats will do anything to destroy this country.They‚Äôve proven all of this is true with the looming indictment and arrest of President Donald Trump on ‚Äútrumped up‚Äù charges. They‚Äôve proven Democrat DA‚Äôs funded by George Soros, combined with Democrat judges and Democrat grand juries, in a deep blue city, filled with liberal loonies and thugs with  ‚ÄúTrump Derangement Syndrome,‚Äù can indict a ham sandwich (as the saying goes).But the real problem is Republicans are weak, feckless, cowards who bring knives to gun fights. Actually, the GOP is more likely to bring golf clubs and a white flag to a gunfight. Our team is afraid of their own shadow and unwilling to hit back hard.The time for being nice and gentlemanly is over. Any indictment, arrest and arraignment of Trump is a declaration of war. They want a war. Let‚Äôs give them a war. And I know how to fight back. Legally.The Soros-funded Democrat scumbag DA of Manhattan‚Ä¶who lets violent criminals walk without bail‚Ä¶even murderers and rapists and attempted cop killers‚Ä¶who has presided over a massive crime wave that has turned Manhattan into a killing field‚Ä¶wants to indict and arrest the former President of the United States, for a 17-year old crime that was never a crime‚Ä¶well beyond the statute of limitations‚Ä¶and out of jurisdiction. So why not do the exact same thing to Democrats?I‚Äôm looking for a few brilliant, ambitious, conservative, patriot DAs and Attorney Generals around the country with cajones. Willing to do the same exact thing to Democrats, as Democrats are doing to Trump. Here is what red city DAs and red state AGs must do‚Ä¶*Indict, arrest and perp walk Hillary Clinton for her crimes. Including the same supposed crime as Trump- campaign finance violations. She used campaign funds to frame Trump for Russian collusion. Hillary has already admitted guilt. Her campaign paid a $115,000 fine.Now it‚Äôs time to indict her in Texas for her crimes. Or Florida. Or Alabama. Or any red city, or red state with cajones.*Indict Obama. He illegally spied on Trump‚Äôs presidential campaign and then on the Trump White House. That‚Äôs treason. Any red state DAs or AGs willing to indict, arrest and perp walk Obama? Why not? He‚Äôs a real criminal. He‚Äôs a traitor to our country.*Indict Bill Clinton. He paid off Paula Jones to coverup an affair. It‚Äôs about sex‚Ä¶it‚Äôs beyond the statute of limitations‚Ä¶and it‚Äôs not a local issue in Texas or Florida. Perfect! It matches this Trump indictment. Extradite Bill to Texas for arraignment.*Indict George Soros. For conspiracy to overthrow USA by funding the open borders invasion and funding woke Marxist DAs who have unleashed a crime wave upon our once great nation.*Indict Eric Holder. He was never prosecuted or punished in any way for committing ‚ÄúContempt of Congress.‚Äù*Indict Mark Zuckerberg. For using $400 million of ‚ÄúZuckerbucks‚Äù to rig and steal the 2020 election.*Indict Nancy Pelosi. For committing fraud and entrapment upon thousands of peaceful protestors on January 6.*Indict Dr. Fauci for mass murder. Do I need to say a thing?*Indict Hunter Biden. For at least 100 federal crimes- including bribery and extortion of foreign governments, on behalf of Vice President Biden.*Of course, Indict Hunter‚Äôs dad Joe. For being ‚Äúthe Big Guy.‚Äù Biden extorted money from China and Ukraine as Vice President. He betrayed the citizens of America and disgraced his office. And to top it off, I‚Äôm betting he committed tax evasion- the same crime as Al Capone. All that money went into offshore accounts. I guarantee you he didn‚Äôt pay taxes.*Lastly, indict Biden, Kamala and Mayorkas. For dereliction of duty, reckless endangerment, and treason for intentionally leaving the border open, and encouraging the illegal foreign invasion of the United States of America.Trump did nothing wrong. But these are all REAL crimes, serious crimes, treason. It‚Äôs time for red city DAs and red state AGs to step up and indict all these dirty Democrat traitors.It‚Äôs time to go nuclear. You want a war, we‚Äôre gonna give you a war. It‚Äôs time for balls, cajones, and big boy pants. Two can play at this game.All of those crimes above are federal crimes, not city, or state.Most are long past the statute of limitations.Just like the Trump case. Wayne Allen Root has the best response to possible Trump arrest:


By Wayne Allyn Root

Here is the problem in America right now‚Ä¶

The Democrats are evil, radical, nasty, vile, low-down, dirty skunks.

Dirty Democrats will do anything to destroy this country.

They‚Äôve proven all of this is true with the looming indictment and arrest of President Donald Trump on ‚Äútrumped up‚Äù charges. They‚Äôve proven Democrat DA‚Äôs funded by George Soros, combined with Democrat judges and Democrat grand juries, in a deep blue city, filled with liberal loonies and thugs with ‚ÄúTrump Derangement Syndrome,‚Äù can indict a ham sandwich (as the saying goes).

But the real problem is Republicans are weak, feckless, cowards who bring knives to gun fights. Actually, the GOP is more likely to bring golf clubs and a white flag to a gunfight. Our team is afraid of their own shadow and unwilling to hit back hard.

The time for being nice and gentlemanly is over. Any indictment, arrest and arraignment of Trump is a declaration of war. They want a war. Let‚Äôs give them a war.



And I know how to fight back. Legally.

The Soros-funded Democrat scumbag DA of Manhattan‚Ä¶who lets violent criminals walk without bail‚Ä¶even murderers and rapists and attempted cop killers‚Ä¶who has presided over a massive crime wave that has turned Manhattan into a killing field‚Ä¶wants to indict and arrest the former President of the United States, for a 17-year old crime that was never a crime‚Ä¶well beyond the statute of limitations‚Ä¶and out of jurisdiction.



So why not do the exact same thing to Democrats?

I‚Äôm looking for a few brilliant, ambitious, conservative, patriot DAs and Attorney Generals around the country with cajones. Willing to do the same exact thing to Democrats, as Democrats are doing to Trump.



Here is what red city DAs and red state AGs must do‚Ä¶

*Indict, arrest and perp walk Hillary Clinton for her crimes. Including the same supposed crime as Trump- campaign finance violations. She used campaign funds to frame Trump for Russian collusion. Hillary has already admitted guilt. Her campaign paid a $115,000 fine.

Now it‚Äôs time to indict her in Texas for her crimes. Or Florida. Or Alabama. Or any red city, or red state with cajones.

*Indict Obama. He illegally spied on Trump‚Äôs presidential campaign and then on the Trump White House. That‚Äôs treason. Any red state DAs or AGs willing to indict, arrest and perp walk Obama? Why not? He‚Äôs a real criminal. He‚Äôs a traitor to our country.

*Indict Bill Clinton. He paid off Paula Jones to coverup an affair. It‚Äôs about sex‚Ä¶it‚Äôs beyond the statute of limitations‚Ä¶and it‚Äôs not a local issue in Texas or Florida. Perfect! It matches this Trump indictment. Extradite Bill to Texas for arraignment.

*Indict George Soros. For conspiracy to overthrow USA by funding the open borders invasion and funding woke Marxist DAs who have unleashed a crime wave upon our once great nation.

*Indict Eric Holder. He was never prosecuted or punished in any way for committing ‚ÄúContempt of Congress.‚Äù

*Indict Mark Zuckerberg. For using $400 million of ‚ÄúZuckerbucks‚Äù to rig and steal the 2020 election.

*Indict Nancy Pelosi. For committing fraud and entrapment upon thousands of peaceful protestors on January 6.

*Indict Dr. Fauci for mass murder. Do I need to say a thing?

*Indict Hunter Biden. For at least 100 federal crimes- including bribery and extortion of foreign governments, on behalf of Vice President Biden.

*Of course, Indict Hunter‚Äôs dad Joe. For being ‚Äúthe Big Guy.‚Äù Biden extorted money from China and Ukraine as Vice President. He betrayed the citizens of America and disgraced his office. And to top it off, I‚Äôm betting he committed tax evasion- the same crime as Al Capone. All that money went into offshore accounts. I guarantee you he didn‚Äôt pay taxes.

*Lastly, indict Biden, Kamala and Mayorkas. For dereliction of duty, reckless endangerment, and treason for intentionally leaving the border open, and encouraging the illegal foreign invasion of the United States of America.

Trump did nothing wrong. But these are all REAL crimes, serious crimes, treason. It‚Äôs time for red city DAs and red state AGs to step up and indict all these dirty Democrat traitors.

It‚Äôs time to go nuclear. You want a war, we‚Äôre gonna give you a war. It‚Äôs time for balls, cajones, and big boy pants. Two can play at this game.

All of those crimes above are federal crimes, not city, or state.

Most are long past the statute of limitations.

Just like the Trump case. It‚Äôs time for Democrats to swallow their own medicine.

Indict a few of these dirty Democrats and watch Soros funded DA Alvin Bragg drop the Trump case in a New York minute. End of story.

_source.content: #BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶  NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"   üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."    "Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶  "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues...  Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive""Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy.""References:* Financial Times - ... * FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23): * Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23): * NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022): * Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022).""West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'"Gab: https://gab.com/BrianBerleticOdysee: https://odysee.com/@LandDestroyer:8Rumble: https://rumble.com/c/c-1459863

#BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ...
* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):
* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

"West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)

Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"

Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."

DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."
Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."

H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."

Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."
eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'"

group.description:
Welcome to GAP - Great Awakening Patriots. 
We discuss The Great Awakening and how to improve America and the rest of the world.

_source.content: #BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic...""Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive""Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy.""References:* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."  "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)  Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"  Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."  DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."  H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'" #BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ
* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):
* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

"West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)

Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"

Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."

DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."
Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."

H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."

Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."
eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'"

Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

#BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ
* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):
* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

"West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)

Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"

Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."

DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."
Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."

H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."

Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."
eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'"

"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;

üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ
* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):
* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

_source.content: #BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic...""Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive""Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy.""References:* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022).""West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'" #BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ
* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):
* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

"West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)

Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"

Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."

DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."
Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."

H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."

Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."
eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'"

group.description: The Qanon group for everyone.  This group is open for sharing, debate and discussion of any and all topics related to the Q Movement. The only rules are stay on topic (Q/Patriotism) and respect each other. Theories and odd ideas are allowed for discussion and debate but abuse, personal attacks, ad-hom arguments and/or stalking is not. Where we go 1... We go ALL!

#BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ

* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):

* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):

* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

#BrianBerletic's #Newatlas Channel: ‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:
* Financial Times - ... 'Error403/censored' üòÇ
* FT - Explosives shortage threatens #EU drive to arm Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* Reuters - üá™üá∫ EU seals plan to send a million #artilleryshells to Ukraine (March 20, 23):
* NYT - Artillery Is Breaking in Ukraine. It‚Äôs Becoming a Problem for the üá∫üá∏ Pentagon. (Nov 25, 2022):
* Alexander Mercouris - Russia Big Gains Bakhmut, üá¨üáß UK MoD Alarmed #Avdeevka; West Stakes All Kiev Offensive; Xi Jinping Moscow (March 21, 23):
* The Telegraph - Putin is 'running out of time' to win the ammunition war against the West (March 9, 23):
* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

"West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZbfsZ2I2gg (39:01)

Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"

Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."

DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."
Shannon MacKenzie: "Sounds like the west is going for broke & here's me thinking the west is already broken."

H K: "Ukraine's third army is about to get reked."

Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."
eric bloodaxe: "Interviewer: 'Mr Johnson, out of all the lies you've ever told, which one is your favourite?' ~ Johnson: 'I've never told any lies.' ~ Interviewer: 'Yes, that's my favourite, too.'"

üá¨üáß "The UKs own BBC article on the UK sending depleted uranium (DU) rounds to Ukraine mentions the UK government's claim that it is harmless, then at the bottom of the article cites the UN which admits DU is highly poisonous and carcinogenic..."
"Dangers of the UKs depleted uranium munitions being sent to Ukraine..."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ "Pro-Ukrainian LIVE UA Map indicates üá∑üá∫ Russian forces pushing further toward Avdeevka's encirclement, as encirclement of Bakhmut continues... Any serious offensive to relieve one or both fortified cities will divert trained manpower and equipment being assembled for üá∫üá¶ Ukraine's upcoming "spring offensive."
Dividing up Ukraine's offensive potential among 2 or more actual operations will diminish the prospects of Ukraine's collective success. Russia has been placing immense pressure on Ukraine, not in terms of seizing territory, but in terms of attrition, chipping away at infrastructure, creating a cumulative impact on Ukraine's overall fighting capacity."

‚öîÔ∏è üá∑üá∫ üá∫üá¶ NEW VIDEO: "West Surges Ammunition Ahead of Ukraine's All-Or-Nothing Offensive"
"Update on #Russian military operations in #Ukraine for March 23, 2023:
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian forces continue encircling the fortified cities of Bakhmut & now Avdeevka, two major points along Ukraine's defense line in the Donbass;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine is gearing up for its upcoming offensive, carrying out drone strikes on üá∑üá∫ Crimea & reconnaissance by force along the line of contact in Zaporozhye;
‚ñ™Ô∏è the stated goal of Ukraine according to Western üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåàreports is to cut the land-bridge between Crimea & the rest of #Russia, though that would hardly isolate #Crimea entirely; *cute*
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine would suffer immense losses, just as they did during the #Kharkov/ #Kherson offensives last year, with the addition of many more Russian troops & extensive defensive works created months in advance;
‚ñ™Ô∏è The üá∫üá∏ US & üá™üá∫ EU are surging remaining stockpiles of artillery ammunition to üá∫üá¶ Ukraine ahead of the offensive to sustain 2-4 months of intense fighting. Once depleted it will take (many) years for the West to restore these stockpiles;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Russian üá∑üá∫ shell production appears to have exceeded Western output as early as 2014-2015 & has continuously increased since meaning Russia's ability to regenerate combat power exceeds the West's at this moment;
‚ñ™Ô∏è Ukraine's upcoming (desperate) offensive should not be underestimated nor the prospects of a breakthrough, Russian forces have repeatedly demonstrated a preference for withdrawing over being encircled or suffering heavy casualties as part of its #attritionstrategy."

"References:

* Novya Gazeta - Barren Barrels (Nov 2022):
* Ukrainian Armed Forces - Russia resumed production of 152-mm shells (Nov 2022):
* Jamestown Foundation - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part One) (Dec 2022):
* Jamestown F. - Russia 'Struggles' to Maintain Munition Stocks (Part Two) (Dec 2022):
* The Moscow Times - Russia Says Ramping Up Ammunition Production for Ukraine War (Jan 2023):
* Defense News - Army acquisition chief would welcome tank ramp-up if üá∫üá∏ Congress funds it (May 2022)."

Joe j: "As a ex Artilleryman gun driver, loader etc on 105 mm Self Propelled Abbot, in a Regiment of 18 gun platforms up to 30% of guns could be in a state of repair in one form or other & that is in peacetime, great show as always Brian!"

Levan Gudadze: "Russian armed forces hit two hangars with weapons & military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) at the Shkolny airfield near Odessa."

DOT DOT: "I believe NATO would join the counteroffensive in the guise of mercenaries; and would be sending every arsenal they have."

Chris Ward: "British military intelligence üòÇüòÇüòÇ I nearly choked on my tea."
